results.title: Man and his world: Japanese farmers
results.brief_description: Presents a study of the cultivation techniques and variety of machinery used by Japanese farmers in developing a rice crop from harsh and non-arable land. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Man and his world: a Norwegian fjord
results.brief_description: This film concerns the gradual reconciliation of the traditional way of life with modern technology and industrial development as it has occurred in the small town of Tyssedal on the Hardangar Fjord in Norway. Once devoted solely to dairy farming, fruit growing and fishing, many of the town’s inhabitants are now employed in the huge aluminium smelting plant located at a short distance from the town. A young Tyssedal school boy and his family are among those affected by this transition in the way of life.

results.title: Man and his resources
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
What is the responsibility of the “haves” towards the “have nots”? This film examines the growing determination of the poor of the world not to remain poor, and the great twentieth-century concept of shared skills and mutual aid.

results.title: Man alive
results.creator_credit: United Productions of America, American Cancer Society, Stephen Bosustow and William T. Hurtz
results.brief_description: A humorous cartoon, about the danger signs of cancer, showing that a man can be irrational about a new rattle in his car, or a warning pain in his body. Stresses the need for regular six-monthly visits to a doctor. The “hero” of the film reacts with gibes, sarcasm, clowning and devilish anger when his wife advises him to take the car to a reputable garage, and have a physical check-up himself. However, he finally seeks expert advice.

results.title: Man against fire
results.brief_description: The story of the fight to save forest resources from wildfire by using planning, research, training and experience. Also details the need for technology, surveillance, strategy, equipment, systems and co-operation. Describes co-operative fire control - federal, state and local - to protect the nation’s water supply, timber, wildlife, recreation and scenic wonders as well as property and lives.

results.title: Man against a fungus
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Maurice Constant
results.brief_description: This film dramatically portrays a struggle that is waged annually in wheat-growing areas - man against the wheat rust fungus. Views of the destruction caused during rust epidemics emphasize the urgency with which plant pathologists are endeavoring to breed resistant wheats and, eventually, to annihilate the blight. Animation, time-lapse photography and cinephotomicrography illustrate the life cycle of the fungus and the complex alternation of generations which poses one of the chief problems.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Maurice Constant

results.title: Man about Europe: Louis Armand
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Anthony de Lotbinière and Georges Robin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pacemakers”.
Louis Armand is the most famous of all France’s civil servant/technocrats - the great moderniser with a clear and steady eye on the needs of people rather than just the capabilities of machines. During the war he organised railway resistance to the Germans, and after the war he was responsible for the electrification of the French National railway system. He persuaded the French to look for oil in the Sahara; he was the man behind Euratom; and is the leader and driving force of the French Channel Tunnel Company.

results.title: Man's experience of the world
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University and Carol Haslam
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
Two interviews with a businessman approaching the end of his successful career and an occupant of a rural commune to study the differences between them and how they relate to the themes in the unit being studied, ie the Social Science Course.
